course_title: Contextual Education Elective: Teaching Peace in Congregations
class_notes: (Concurrent Enrollment in CE 552b/ANGb/TPb required; permission number is required to enroll and should be requested by emailing candlerregistrar@emory.edu beginning April 8, 2020 at 7:00 am) (ONLINE: synchronous live sessions Tuesdays 3:00pm-5:00pm; remaining contact time fulfilled via asynchronous online engagement)
course_description:
Con Ed Elective for students in CE II/TP II/EASP II.
Congregational leaders are in a position to "teach peace" in the church, because peace education embraces both explicit (teaching about war and peace) & implicit (how is outreach conducted or conflict resolved) forms. This course explores the definitions and theories of violence and nonviolence in relation to theological and historical resources and then considers several aspects of congregational life as means of teaching peace, including bible study, mission/outreach, leadership & administration, religious ed, worship and prayer.
